item.title: Signing and verifying messages with RSA keys, using Python and C#
item.description: Overview I recently needed to: Create a message on a Linux server. Some time later, read the message on a Windows computer. Be pretty darn sure the message hadn’t been tampered with. Public-key cryptography (aka asymmetric cryptography) to the rescue! Paraphrasing Wikipedia’s definition, public-key cryptography is a system that uses pairs of keys: public keys which may be shared widely, and private keys which are known only to the owner.
